message.content: This question requires basic knowledge about the effects of temperature on objects. When Skittles (candy) are left in snow, the cold temperature causes them to freeze and become hard. Option (A) is incorrect because snow is a very cold substance and it would not cause the Skittles to become hot. Option (B) is incorrect because mushy texture is not a typical result of placing candy in snow. Option (D) is also incorrect because snow would not cause the Skittles to become soft.

This question requires some basic knowledge about the physical properties of water and how they change with temperature. When Skittles are left in snow, they are exposed to cold temperatures. As a result, the water content in the Skittles freezes and they become hard. Option (A) is incorrect because the Skittles are not heated in the snow. Option (B) is incorrect because they do not become mushy, as that would require them to be exposed to heat. Option (D) is incorrect because they do not become soft, as that would also require them to be exposed to heat.

This question requires basic knowledge about the properties of Skittles and how they react to different temperatures. When Skittles are left in snow, they will become hard. This is because the cold temperature of the snow causes the candy shell of the Skittles to solidify and become firm. Option (A) is incorrect because the Skittles do not become hot in the snow. Option (B) is incorrect because mushiness implies a soft and squishy texture, which is not what happens to Skittles in the snow. Option (D) is also incorrect because the Skittles do not become soft in the snow.
